intro: Gaultheria fimbriata, commonly known as the red-flowered wintergreen, is a species of flowering plant in the Ericaceae family. It is native to the temperate regions of South America, particularly in Chile and Argentina. The plant is characterized by its evergreen foliage and clusters of bell-shaped, red flowers that bloom in late winter to early spring. Its leaves are typically leathery and have a distinctive, serrated edge. Gaultheria fimbriata is also valued for its aromatic properties and is sometimes used in traditional medicine.
